    • Method Detail

      • findClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> findClass(java.lang.String className,
                           java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)
        Look up a class with the specified class loader (or the boot class loader if classLoader is null).

        Class names can be specified in different formats:

        • java.lang.Integer
        • int
        • int[]
        • [I
        • java.lang.String[]
        • [Ljava.lang.String;
        • android.app.ActivityThread.ResourcesKey
        • android.app.ActivityThread$ResourcesKey
        • android.app.ActivityThread$ResourcesKey[]

        A XtensionHelpers.ClassNotFoundError is thrown in case the class was not found.

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.String module,
       java.lang.String s)
        xTension logging for module messages
        Parameters:
        module - module name
        s - log message

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.Throwable t)
        xTension logging for module errors
        Parameters:
        t - error throwable

      • findField

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field findField(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                java.lang.String fieldName)
        Look up a field in a class and set it to accessible. The result is cached. If the field was not found, a NoSuchFieldError will be thrown.

      • findMethodExact

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method findMethodExact(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                       java.lang.String methodName,
                                       java.lang.Object... parameterTypes)
        Look up a method in a class and set it to accessible. The result is cached. If the method was not found, a NoSuchMethodError will be thrown.

        The parameter types may either be specified as Class or String objects. In the latter case, the class is looked up using findClass(java.lang.String, java.lang.ClassLoader) with the same class loader as the method's class.

      • findAndHookMethod

        public static XTE_MethodHook.Unhook findAndHookMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                      java.lang.String methodName,
                                      java.lang.Object... parameterTypesAndCallback)
        Look up a method and place a hook on it. The last argument must be the callback for the hook.
        See Also:
        findMethodExact(Class, String, Object...)

      • findMethodExact

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method findMethodExact(java.lang.String className,
                                       java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader,
                                       java.lang.String methodName,
                                       java.lang.Object... parameterTypes)
        See Also:

      • findMethodExact

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method findMethodExact(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                       java.lang.String methodName,
                                       java.lang.Class<?>... parameterTypes)
        Look up a method in a class and set it to accessible. The result is cached. If the method was not found, a NoSuchMethodError will be thrown.

      • findMethodBestMatch

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method findMethodBestMatch(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                           java.lang.String methodName,
                                           java.lang.Class<?>... parameterTypes)
        Look up a method in a class and set it to accessible. The result is cached. This does not only look for exact matches, but for the closest match. If the method was not found, a NoSuchMethodError will be thrown.
        See Also:
        MethodUtils.getMatchingAccessibleMethod(java.lang.Class<?>, java.lang.String, java.lang.Class<?>...)

      • findMethodBestMatch

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method[] findMethodBestMatch(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                             java.lang.Class<?> returnType,
                                             java.lang.Class<?>... parameterTypes)
        Look up a methods in a class and set it to accessible. Parameter types are determined from the parameterTypes for the method call. Return type are determined from the returnType. The result is cached. This does not only look for exact matches, but for the closest match.

      • findMethodBestMatch

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method findMethodBestMatch(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                           java.lang.String methodName,
                                           java.lang.Object... args)
        Look up a method in a class and set it to accessible. Parameter types are determined from the args for the method call. The result is cached. This does not only look for exact matches, but for the closest match. If the method was not found, a NoSuchMethodError will be thrown.

      • findMethodBestMatch

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method findMethodBestMatch(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                           java.lang.String methodName,
                                           java.lang.Class<?>[] parameterTypes,
                                           java.lang.Object[] args)
        Look up a method in a class and set it to accessible. Parameter types are preferably taken from the parameterTypes. Any item in this array that is null is determined from the corresponding item in args. The result is cached. This does not only look for exact matches, but for the closest match. If the method was not found, a NoSuchMethodError will be thrown.

      • callMethod

        public static java.lang.Object callMethod(java.lang.Object obj,
                          java.lang.String methodName,
                          java.lang.Object... args)
        Call instance or static method methodName for object obj with the arguments args. The types for the arguments will be determined automaticall from args

      • callMethod

        public static java.lang.Object callMethod(java.lang.Object obj,
                          java.lang.String methodName,
                          java.lang.Class<?>[] parameterTypes,
                          java.lang.Object... args)
        Call instance or static method methodName for object obj with the arguments args. The types for the arguments will be taken from parameterTypes. This array can have items that are null. In this case, the type for this parameter is determined from args.

      • callStaticMethod

        public static java.lang.Object callStaticMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                java.lang.String methodName,
                                java.lang.Object... args)
        Call static method methodName for class clazz with the arguments args. The types for the arguments will be determined automaticall from args

      • callStaticMethod

        public static java.lang.Object callStaticMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                java.lang.String methodName,
                                java.lang.Class<?>[] parameterTypes,
                                java.lang.Object... args)
        Call static method methodName for class clazz with the arguments args. The types for the arguments will be taken from parameterTypes. This array can have items that are null. In this case, the type for this parameter is determined from args.
